Heboh 'Desa Hantu', Sri Mulyani Dianggap Cuma Bikin Gaduh
06 Nov 2019, 23:52 by Sylke Febrina Laucereno


Ilustrasi Foto: Dok.

Jakarta - Fenomena adanya desa tak berpenduduk alias 'desa hantu' banyak menuai respons dari berbagi kalangan. Awalnya, informasi tersebut diungkap oleh Menteri Keuangan Sri Mulyani Indrawati di depan anggota Komisi XI DPR.'Desa hantu' yang dimaksud bukan desa berhantu, melainkan desa yang sengaja dibentuk demi mendapatkan keuntungan atau desa yang wilayahnya masih ada namun ditinggalkan penduduknya karena bencana.Sri Mulyani Indrawati dinilai hanya membuat gaduh dengan mengungkapkan adanya 'desa hantu'. Bahkan, Presiden Jokowi pun ikut meresponnya. Kementerian Dalam Negeri (Kemendagri) mengungkapkan bahwa fenomena 'desa hantu' alias tak berpenghuni berada di salah satu Kabupaten, Provinsi Sulawesi Tenggara. Desa tersebut sengah dibentuk demi mendapatkan aliran uang program dana desa.Dirjen Bina Pemerintahan Desa Kemendagri, Nata Irawan mengatakan bahwa pembentukan desa fiktif ini sudah lama terjadi dan telah terendus oleh Komisi Pemberantasan Korupsi (KPK)."Itu isu sudah lama, tapi dikembangkan lagi, sudah pernah didiskusikan oleh KPK, di salah satu desa di Sulawesi salah satu Kabupaten ada desa fiktif," kata Nata saat dihubungi detikcom, Jakarta, Selasa (5/11/2019).Nata mengungkapkan ada empat 'desa hantu' alias fiktif yang selama ini sudah menerima aliran dana desa. Pihaknya pun telah menurunkan tim untuk melakukan pemeriksaan."Ditjen Bina Pemerintahan Desa membentuk tim, tim kami turun melihat langsung benar ada atau tidak isu itu, ternyata memang ada 4 desa yang tidak memenuhi syarat terbentuk menjadi sebuah desa," tegas Nata.Lanjut ke halaman berikutnya >>> (kil/ang)

Splashy 'Ghost Village', Sri Mulyani Is Considered to Only Make Gaduh
Nov 6, 2019, 23:52 by Sylke Febrina Laucereno


Photo Illustration: Doc.

Jakarta - The phenomenon of the existence of uninhabited villages, aka 'ghost villages', has drawn a response from various groups. Initially, the information was revealed by the Minister of Finance Sri Mulyani Indrawati in front of the House's Commission XI members. The intended 'ghost village' is not a haunted village, but a village that was intentionally formed for profit or a village whose territory still exists but is abandoned by residents due to the disaster. Sri Mulyani Indrawati is considered only making noise by revealing the existence of a 'ghost village'. In fact, President Jokowi also responded. The Ministry of Home Affairs (Kemendagri) revealed that the phenomenon of 'ghost villages', aka uninhabited, is located in one of the regencies, Southeast Sulawesi Province. The village was half formed to get the money flow of the village fund program. Director General of Village Ministry of Home Affairs Development, Nata Irawan said that the formation of this fictitious village had been a long time ago and had been detected by the Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK). The KPK has already discussed it, in one village in Sulawesi one of the regencies there is a fictitious village, "Nata said when contacted by AFP, Jakarta, Tuesday (11/05/2019). Nata revealed there were four 'ghost villages' aka fictitious ones that had been has received a stream of village funds. "The Directorate General of Village Government Development formed a team, our team went down to see whether there was a real issue or not, apparently there were 4 villages that did not meet the requirements to form a village," said Nata.
